intro: Plagiobothrys torreyi var. diffusus, commonly known as the spreading sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. It is often found in coastal dunes and other arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
